intro: Rinorea oxycarpa, commonly known as the red-fruit rinorea, is a small shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature, which are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Rinorea oxycarpa is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
